subject: Horse Racing
Floods
lead_paragraph: Santa Anita in Arcadia, Calif., called off live racing Thursday for the fourth time this month because of heavy rainfall and overnight hail on a synthetic track that has had drainage problems since its installation. The track was open for simulcast racing. Ron Charles, the track president, said he was confident that a binding element applied to the racing surface, when the weather improved, would solve the drainage problem.
